channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9630] Add thread which detects JVM pauses like HADOOP's
item.description: Todd adds daemon threads for dn&nn to indicate the VM or kernel caused pause in application log, it's pretty handy for diagnose, i thought it's great to have similar ability in HBase.
item.summary: Add thread which detects JVM pauses like HADOOP's

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
nit: In the master, we should do as in the region region server: grouping the creation & the start, w/o testing for null.
+ if (this.pauseMonitor != null)

{ + pauseMonitor.start(); + }

+1 on the idea, I haven't tested the patch but it seems ok. I'm not sure about the interruptions management, but I guess it's good enough.

thanks for review, Nicolas. based on current patch, the secondary HMaster could avoid running a needless thread(in my opnion, seems nobody will pay attention to the secondary HMaster in normal situation, right?), do you agree me

I think it might be useful to have it in the secondary master as well. For example, if the secondary master is paused sometimes, we want to know this before it becomes the primary master. Or if it starts to be paused when it becomes the primary, we will want to know how it was behaving before imho.

Can you reference the hadoop ticket(s) that add this feature? Can we not just use the hadoop JvmPauseMonitor directly? At the very least, please include the source hadoop class and svn revision number in the javadoc for JvmPauseMonitor.

Thanks Nick Dimiduk, now it links with the original hadoop jira
it seems HADOOP-9618 is in hadoop trunk only, so to me, it's not easy to use the hadoop's directly, probably need reflection...

will upload another patch according to [~liochon] and Nick Dimiduk's comments.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12604729/HBase-9630-v2.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to cause Findbugs (version 1.3.9) to fail.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7349//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7349//console

This message is automatically generated.

Updated patch looks good to me. +1.

I'll commit this later today unless there's any objection.
I was looking for the findbugs warning, does it come from this patch?

I don't see findbugs report under:
https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7349/artifact/trunk/patchprocess/
Running findbugs locally vs trunk and trunk + patch, we'll see what I find.

Looks to me like this patch is clean:

$ diff /tmp/trunk/hbase-server-findbugsXml-formatted.xml /tmp/HBASE-9630/hbase-server-findbugsXml-formatted.xml |egrep -n "bugs=|bugCount="

Committed to 0.96 and trunk. Thanks for the addition, Liang Xie.

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
